entry.def: Schooling is education that children receive at school.

example.tran: 他几乎没受过正式的学校教育。

example.ex: ...a voucher scheme to help poorer families pay for private schooling.
example.tran: 帮助较贫穷家庭支付私立学校学费的代币券计划

means.word_mean: 1. the act of teaching at school
2. the process of being formally educated at a school;

sentences.sentence: "what will you do when you finish school?"

means.word_mean: 3. the training of an animal (especially the training of a horse for dressage)

Sentence.sentence: Almost every child, on the first day he sets foot in a school building, is smarter, more curious, less afraid of what he doesn't know, better at finding and figuring things out, more confident, resourceful (机敏的), persistent and independent than he will ever be again in his schooling – or, unless he is very unusual and very lucky, for the rest of his life.
It's difficult to estimate the number of youngsters involved in home schooling where children are not sent to school and receive their formal education from one or both parents.
Critics of the home schooling movement content that it creates as many problems as it solves
They acknowledge that, in a few cases, home schooling offers educational opportunities superior to those found in most public schools, but few parents can provide such educational advantages.

sentences.en: children’s development in the early years of schooling
sentences.cn: 孩子们在早期学校教育中的发展

sentences.en: A child’s access to schooling varies greatly from area to area.
sentences.cn: 孩子获得学校教育的机会因地区不同而大相径庭。

sentences.en: An illiterate,later he received some schooling.
sentences.cn: 他原先大字不识一个,后来接受一些学校教育。
